summary: This FBI document is a funding request for an undercover operation targeting Alfredo Rodriguez, a former employee of Jeffrey Epstein. Rodriguez attempted to sell documents related to the Epstein civil litigation to attorney Bradley J. Edwards, who was representing plaintiffs suing Epstein, instead of complying with a federal subpoena. The operation involved show money and incurred wire transfer fees.

persons.name: Alfredo Rodriguez
persons.role: Previous employee of Jeffrey Epstein, subject of undercover operation
persons.context: A former Epstein employee who, after being deposed and served with a federal subpoena, attempted to sell case-related documents to plaintiffs' attorney Bradley Edwards instead of complying, leading to an FBI undercover operation.

persons.name: Bradley J. Edwards
persons.role: Attorney representing plaintiffs suing Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: An attorney who deposed Alfredo Rodriguez and was contacted by Rodriguez attempting to sell documents relevant to the civil litigation against Epstein, to whom Edwards explained the illegality of the demand.

persons.name: Jeffery Epstein
persons.context: The subject of a civil lawsuit brought by four female plaintiffs represented by Bradley Edwards; his former employee, Alfredo Rodriguez, possessed documents related to the case.

connections.description: Rodriguez is identified as a previous employee of Epstein.
Edwards, as an attorney in the Epstein civil case, deposed Rodriguez and served him with a federal subpoena; Rodriguez later contacted Edwards to sell documents.
Edwards was the attorney representing four female plaintiffs who were suing Epstein.

events.title: Initial Contact by Rodriguez
events.description: Alfredo Rodriguez contacted attorney Bradley J. Edwards, offering to sell documents related to the Epstein civil case.

events.title: Undercover Meeting to Sell Documents
events.description: Alfredo Rodriguez met with an undercover employee (UCE) in an attempt to sell the subpoenaed documents.

events.title: FBI Funding Request
events.description: The FBI requested $275.00 to reimburse wire transfer fees for an undercover operation involving show money to facilitate the purchase of documents from Rodriguez.

keyFacts: Alfredo Rodriguez, a former Epstein employee, attempted to profit by selling documents subject to a federal subpoena related to the Epstein civil litigation.
Plaintiffs' attorney Bradley J. Edwards refused Rodriguez's illegal demand for payment and explained Rodriguez's legal obligation to comply with the subpoena.
The FBI authorized an undercover operation with $50,000 in 'show money' to investigate Rodriguez's attempt to sell the documents.
The document is a routine FBI funding request for $275 to cover wire transfer fees associated with the undercover operation.
